title: Reborn as AI: My Son's Story
subTitle: A pair of parents uses AI to create an avatar of their son, a victim of a high school mass shooting, to navigate their trauma and speak out against gun violence.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Barakan Discovers HAGI
subTitle: Yoshida Shoin was an educator whose students played key roles in Japan's modernization. He died at 29, but his ideals still live on 160 years later. Peter Barakan visits Shoin's hometown of Hagi.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
subTitle: A natural history show that's a huge hit with families in Japan has gone global! The series explores the amazing and delightful stories of animals all around the world, including Japan.

title: Time-Lapse Journey
subTitle: A collection of time-lapse photography showcasing the beautiful and eclectic scenery of Kyoto which was once called the old capital of Japan.

title: Let's Enjoy Math with Barky the Dog
subTitle: Numbler erases a part of a cake delivery memo, resulting in the delivery of four cakes instead of one. Barky solves the mystery by showing the difference between ordinal numbers and cardinal numbers.

title: Take Tech
subTitle: Explores the feedback control which helps in adjusting the temperature in the bath and the refrigerator.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cycle Around Japan
subTitle: We cycle the Noto Peninsula, hit by a major earthquake in 2024. We visit a temporary morning market where people who lost their shops sell goods, and a salt-maker keeping traditional methods alive.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: 80 Years and Beyond
subTitle: Japan inflicted deep wounds in World War Two but suffered two atomic bombs. The people in this program, from high schoolers to historians, use this dark chapter in history to build a brighter future.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Japan's snow is a big draw for tourists, but snow and ice can also pose dangers to drivers. We'll look at some Japanese technology being developed to prevent whiteouts and accidents on slippery roads.

title: Design Museum Japan
subTitle: The Mincho font, drawn by hand in around 1990, evokes 350-year-old hand-carved woodblocks, made to print Buddhist sutras.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: History Uncovered
subTitle: Uncovering the history of Japan, its culture and its people as they each evolved over the centuries.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to a play and acting. Explore the unique culture behind them.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai, large parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronised performance.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NEO-JAPONISM
subTitle: Explores the hidden world of the Senke Jusshoku, ten legendary families who have served as the exclusive artisans for Japan's most prestigious tea ceremony lineages for centuries.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Masterpieces Performed by NHK Symphony Orchestra
subTitle: Keitaro Harada conducts a performance of Dvořák, Symphony No. 9 in E minor Op. 95 'From the New World', by the NHK Symphony Orchestra.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Tiny Desk Concerts Japan
subTitle: The unit formed by Okamura Yasuyuki and Saito Kazuyoshi makes its debut in the intimate tiny desk space inside the NHK office.

title: Little Charo
subTitle: Charo helps Candy collect flowers to make a wish for Chris' surgery. On the following day, he shows empathy for her.

title: Japanology Plus Mini
subTitle: The kotatsu table, a staple of Japanese households, is so culturally significant that it features in pop culture around the world.

title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
subTitle: A local cat guides viewers to a fairy tale palace-or rather, a shrine that looks like the palace. Together with Iwago, visit some scenic spots, including a tea farm that's patrolled by an early-rising cat.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Anime Manga Explosion
subTitle: Discovers the secrets of Japanese anime and manga as their popularity continues to grow. Considers the appeal of these Japanese productions internationally, how they're created, and their cultural significance.

title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
subTitle: As Rockie is unable to find a good response to her teacher's question, Rapper comes in to teach her a handy phrase to use in such situations.

title: U & I
subTitle: I is hurt because U seems to ignore him, but he finds out that U is now unable to see anything. U talks to I about the life of the visually impaired.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Somewhere Street
subTitle: Davao, located on Mindanao Island, is home to 1.7 million people. Global business such as call centers are now thriving here. This city is often cited as being one of the safest in the Philippines.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Through the Kitchen Window
subTitle: Harasawa Shoko's family lovingly call her the prime minister of apples. If only all governments functioned as well as her brilliant orchard. The Gunma Meigetsu is a rare apple, famed for its sweet honey-like centre.

title: Core Kyoto Mini
subTitle: A look at the maki-e, a Japanese lacquer decoration technique in which pictures, patterns, and letters are drawn with lacquer on the surface of lacquerware before metal powder such as gold is sprinkled and fixed on the surface.

title: Easy Japanese for Work
subTitle: The first in a special two-part EJW series. On Easy Japanese for Work, we've looked at many Japanese phrases that people use at work. Today, we review past phrases and learn keego through fun games.

title: Zero Waste Life
subTitle: Bicycle lover Yamamoto Atsushi makes items like handbags from old bicycle parts. Unable to simply watch them being discarded, he sees giving them a new purpose his true calling in life.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Somewhere Street

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Chatroom Japan
subTitle: A Ghanaian entrepreneur and resident of Japan launched an online radio station as a way of giving back to the community. The project is inspiring some young Africans to pursue their own dreams.

title: IMPACTS:Climates Change the World
subTitle: Dengue fever cases worldwide have risen to 30 times their levels 20 years ago, with global warming connected to infection spread by mosquitoes, especially in countries such as the Philippines.

title: Design Museum Japan
subTitle: The Mincho font, drawn by hand in around 1990, evokes 350-year-old hand-carved woodblocks, made to print Buddhist sutras.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Time-Lapse Japan
subTitle: The Jomon period lasted from around 13,000 BC to 300 BC. This society of hunter-gatherers cherished peace, cooperation and connection to the natural world. A look at the Sannai Maruyama site, where 6,000 years ago, a large settlement was established.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Japan's snow is a big draw for tourists, but snow and ice can also pose dangers to drivers. We'll look at some Japanese technology being developed to prevent whiteouts and accidents on slippery roads.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: Poet Peter MacMillan takes a look into the Japanese words that relate to hot water and a bath, with Japan being renowned for hot springs and hot tea.

title: Easy Japanese
subTitle: Teaching about how to ask someone to speak slowly.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: Li Xiaoyu explains how Japanese toys spark the market with their advanced technology and kawaii culture.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: NHK World-Japan introduces several of its programmes to a global audience, like special reports and documentaries. These programmes provide the world with a window into the Japanese station and offer the latest in Japanese news.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai, large parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronised performance.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: The nuns prepare for a seasonal event based on the solar calendar. Later on, they make special sushi, salads and dumplings.

title: Seasoning the Seasons
subTitle: Explores the history of nabe, or hot pot, a classic winter cuisine in Japan, and looks at the stories of happiness surrounding this warm, wonderful dish.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NHK World-Japan Special Program
subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: One in Every Japanese
subTitle: One in 156 Japanese are transgenders. In a society still lacking in understanding, talking to transgender people about work, marriage, leisure, as they try to live their normal daily lives.

title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
subTitle: A natural history show that's a huge hit with families in Japan has gone global! The series explores the amazing and delightful stories of animals all around the world, including Japan.

title: Time-Lapse Journey
subTitle: A collection of time-lapse photography showcasing the beautiful and eclectic scenery of Kyoto which was once called the old capital of Japan.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NHK World-Japan Special Program
subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a sword made by Kuniyuki that is imbued with the power of the deity known as Fudo-myo-o.

title: Hometown Stories
subTitle: Featuring painter Yoshinari Ishimura, who has autism. His late mother sparked his love of animals, which now inspires his work. With his father's help, Yoshinari expands his world and brings joy to others.

title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
subTitle: Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko show how they prepare their tasty and sweet dried persimmons, a process which takes weeks to complete.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt Fuji and discovers its secrets.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Ultra-thin noodles and amber broth: the story of a people who overcame disaster and their favourite bowl of ramen.

subTitle: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Shirakawa-go is one of Japan's snowiest regions, famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. Every detail of life here is reflected in the cooperative bond shared by residents.

title: Hit the Road
subTitle: A drive through Japan's Hiroshima Prefecture on a trip to reach the famed Itsukushima Shrine. Along the way, travels off the beaten path to make stops at some exceptional locations.

title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
subTitle: A natural history show that's a huge hit with families in Japan has gone global! The series explores the amazing and delightful stories of animals all around the world, including Japan.

subTitle: NHK's core news program wrapping up the day's events in an easy to understand way.

subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

title: Newsroom Tokyo
subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: Follows the nuns on the day of Risshun as they enjoy unique versions of colourful neko-mochi rice cakes featuring unusual ingredients. They then celebrate Girls' Day with a special tea ceremony on the day of Usui.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Hara Kazuo, a Golden Ring Special Edition prize winner, talks about his vision for documentaries and the dark side of movies.

title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo Mini
subTitle: A look at horsehair crab, one of Japan's top-selling seafood delicacies. In crab-loving Japan, highlighting what exactly makes this hairy little guy such an unforgettable attraction.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Witnesses the virtual excursion from an airplane and takes a look at the wonderful view during the flight to Fukuoka from an airplane window.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: A man strikes a pose in an iconic woodblock print by the artist Sharaku. We investigate who the mysterious figure is, examine what is he doing, and discuss why the artist wanted to commemorate the moment.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A large-scale study in Japan has shown that improving one's diet and lifestyle can slow the progression of chronic kidney disease. Clinical trials in regenerative medicine are also underway.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai, large parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronised performance.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: The nuns prepare for a seasonal event based on the solar calendar. Later on, they make special sushi, salads and dumplings.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: Poet Peter MacMillan takes a look into the Japanese words that relate to hot water and a bath, with Japan being renowned for hot springs and hot tea.

title: Easy Japanese
subTitle: Teaching about how to ask someone to speak slowly.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: Li Xiaoyu explains how Japanese toys spark the market with their advanced technology and kawaii culture.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: NHK World-Japan introduces several of its programmes to a global audience, like special reports and documentaries. These programmes provide the world with a window into the Japanese station and offer the latest in Japanese news.

title: Newsroom Tokyo
subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: Featuring creative new approaches to selling apparel products in Japan.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a sword made by Kuniyuki that is imbued with the power of the deity known as Fudo-myo-o.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Hara Kazuo, a Golden Ring Special Edition prize winner, talks about his vision for documentaries and the dark side of movies.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Hara Kazuo, a Golden Ring Special Edition prize winner, talks about his vision for documentaries and the dark side of movies.

title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo Mini
subTitle: A look at horsehair crab, one of Japan's top-selling seafood delicacies. In crab-loving Japan, highlighting what exactly makes this hairy little guy such an unforgettable attraction.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Witnesses the virtual excursion from an airplane and takes a look at the wonderful view during the flight to Fukuoka from an airplane window.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: A man strikes a pose in an iconic woodblock print by the artist Sharaku. We investigate who the mysterious figure is, examine what is he doing, and discuss why the artist wanted to commemorate the moment.

title: Face to Face
subTitle: Kawashima Toru is a chef of Japanese cuisine based in Noto. Through the power of food and human connection, he's been working to help the region recover from the New Year's Day 2024 earthquake.

title: Seasoning the Seasons
subTitle: Explores the history of nabe, or hot pot, a classic winter cuisine in Japan, and looks at the stories of happiness surrounding this warm, wonderful dish.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai, large parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronised performance.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: The nuns prepare for a seasonal event based on the solar calendar. Later on, they make special sushi, salads and dumplings.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A large-scale study in Japan has shown that improving one's diet and lifestyle can slow the progression of chronic kidney disease. Clinical trials in regenerative medicine are also underway.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt Fuji and discovers its secrets.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Ultra-thin noodles and amber broth: the story of a people who overcame disaster and their favourite bowl of ramen.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: Featuring creative new approaches to selling apparel products in Japan.

title: One in Every Japanese
subTitle: One in 156 Japanese are transgenders. In a society still lacking in understanding, talking to transgender people about work, marriage, leisure, as they try to live their normal daily lives.

title: Magical Japanese
subTitle: Poet Peter MacMillan takes a look into the Japanese words that relate to hot water and a bath, with Japan being renowned for hot springs and hot tea.

subTitle: NHK World-Japan introduces several of its programmes to a global audience, like special reports and documentaries. These programmes provide the world with a window into the Japanese station and offer the latest in Japanese news.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Shirakawa-go is one of Japan's snowiest regions, famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. Every detail of life here is reflected in the cooperative bond shared by residents.

title: Hit the Road
subTitle: A drive through Japan's Hiroshima Prefecture on a trip to reach the famed Itsukushima Shrine. Along the way, travels off the beaten path to make stops at some exceptional locations.

title: Hometown Stories
subTitle: Featuring painter Yoshinari Ishimura, who has autism. His late mother sparked his love of animals, which now inspires his work. With his father's help, Yoshinari expands his world and brings joy to others.

title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
subTitle: Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko show how they prepare their tasty and sweet dried persimmons, a process which takes weeks to complete.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: Featuring creative new approaches to selling apparel products in Japan.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a sword made by Kuniyuki that is imbued with the power of the deity known as Fudo-myo-o.

title: Journeys in Japan
subTitle: Explores the neighbourhood alongside the Uchikawa River in Imizu City, Toyama Prefecture, which has been a thriving fishing port for over 1,000 years.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: My Street Piano
subTitle: On a shopping street in front of Kagoshima Chuo Station sits Japan's original street piano, which passersby love to visit and play from the heart.

title: Dining with the Chef
subTitle: Hosts Yu Hayami and Patrick Harlan, with the help of Japanese chefs Tatsuo Saito and Rika Yukimasa, introduce the uninitiated to the techniques, ingredients and harmony of Japanese cuisine.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: In Saidaiji Eyo, thousands of near-naked men endure icy water and the winter cold as they are purified at a temple. Some of the normal rites are being reintroduced as the pandemic recedes.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: We learn about the autumn dates of kanro and soko. The nuns pick up chestnuts and cook gammodoki on the day of kanro. They then prepare mochi rice with homemade miso.

title: Document 72 Hours
subTitle: A public library in Kanazawa resembles a sublime theatre and offers more than 1.1 million books. For three days, we asked people what books piqued their interest and how they spend their time here.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NHK World-Japan Special Program
subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: One in Every Japanese
subTitle: One in 45 Japanese are suspected of a gambling addiction. Following a man who made a clean break from gambling, overcoming the crisis of a broken family, and is in the recovery process from addiction.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A large-scale study in Japan has shown that improving one's diet and lifestyle can slow the progression of chronic kidney disease. Clinical trials in regenerative medicine are also underway.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, an in-depth look at Hotei Kunihiro, a sword conveying a swordsmith's wish for peace.

title: Deeper Look
subTitle: As nuclear threats remain, what can we learn from A-bomb survivors? Michigan State University's Wake Naoko shares stories from hibakushas in America.

title: Dig More Japan!
subTitle: Japan is home to countless good luck charms meant to bring health or long life. We dig a little deeper. Hope you're feeling lucky!

title: Dining with the Chef Mini
subTitle: Chef Saito presents a fun and healthy recipe for cherry blossom-shaped crab rice, which is easy enough for anyone to make.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: Kyle Card hikes along the 621 miles trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan, where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Embarking on a pleasantly flavourful journey through Kagoshima Prefecture's diverse ramen, featuring a distinct evolution within Kyushu's tonkotsu realm.

title: Journeys in Japan
subTitle: Explores the neighbourhood alongside the Uchikawa River in Imizu City, Toyama Prefecture, which has been a thriving fishing port for over 1,000 years.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Japan's snow is a big draw for tourists, but snow and ice can also pose dangers to drivers. We'll look at some Japanese technology being developed to prevent whiteouts and accidents on slippery roads.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: The heavily forested Shiretoko Peninsula in eastern Hokkaido is lined with tall peaks. Its extraordinary, intertwined ecosystem extends over both land and sea and is home to diverse species.

title: Hit the Road
subTitle: Take a drive in Fukushima! 13 years since the disaster, see its rejuvenated community and daily life. Visit the rest stop emblematic of this resilience and sense the locals' unyielding spirit.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A large-scale study in Japan has shown that improving one's diet and lifestyle can slow the progression of chronic kidney disease. Clinical trials in regenerative medicine are also underway.

subTitle: NHK's core news program wrapping up the day's events in an easy to understand way.

subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

subTitle: Explores the neighbourhood alongside the Uchikawa River in Imizu City, Toyama Prefecture, which has been a thriving fishing port for over 1,000 years.

subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: A look at the two traditional Japanese spring dates of keichitsu and shunbun. In addition, the chefs enjoy nobiru and fresh bamboo shoots, two staples of the springtime menu in Japan.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: For more than 150 years, the Yamamoto family has crafted soy sauce in wooden barrels. Whilst this traditional method is nearly extinct, Yasuo Yamamoto is determined to preserve it for future generations.

title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo Mini
subTitle: Featuring kuzu, a Japanese ingredient with over 1,000 years of history. Kuzu powder is used in many ways. Sweeten it to make a tasty treat, use it as a thickener, or sprinkle it on food to enhance umami.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Embarking on a series of journeys through the skies over Japan, flying to airports across Japan to enjoy breathtaking views from the airplane window. This time, tracking the flight from Kagoshima to Amami Airport.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: We observe Red Fuji and Black Fuji, two dramatically different views of Japan's most famous mountain, captured by the artist Hokusai.

subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.
